div.div: The purpose of this website is for parents and/or guardians of students enrolled within one of our schools in the Fillmore Unified School District to be able to request for a device that can be used for distance learning.

article.aria-label: The Board Meeting of March 17, 2020 is canceled

h3.a: The Board Meeting of March 17, 2020 is canceled

div.div: The Fillmore Unified School District will close all of our schools beginning Monday, March 16 through Friday, March 20. All district and school events, meetings, activities, athletic practices, and athletic competitions are canceled during the week of March 16, 2020.

article.aria-label: 2020 Census: What You Need to Know

h3.a: 2020 Census: What You Need to Know

img.alt: 2020 Census: What You Need to Know Featured Photo

div.div: The Census is a count of every person living in the U.S. every 10 years. The count is mandated by Article 1, Section 2, of the U.S. Constitution to ensure residents in every state receive fair representation and resources.

article.aria-label: Censo 2020: Que Debe Saber (Haga clic aquí para más información.)

h3.a: Censo 2020: Que Debe Saber (Haga clic aquí para más información.)

img.alt: Censo 2020: Que Debe Saber (Haga clic aquí para más información.) Featured Photo

div.div: El censo es un recuento de cada persona que vive en los Estados Unidos y se realiza cada 10 años. El recuento es ordenado por el Artículo 1, Sección 2, de la Constitución de los Estados Unidos para asegurar que los residentes de cada estado reciban una representación y recursos justos.

article.aria-label: Fillmore Unified School District Approved for an Additional $3 Million in Matching Funds for Career Technical Education Facility

h3.a: Fillmore Unified School District Approved for an Additional $3 Million in Matching Funds for Career Technical Education Facility

img.alt: Fillmore Unified School District Approved for an Additional $3 Million in Matching Funds for Career Technical Education Facility Featured Photo

div.div: • The Fillmore USD Agriculture pathway is one of 70 applications approved by the State Allocation Board to receive $3 Million in reserved funds for new construction • Today’s action has resulted in a total of $6 Million in matching funds from the State of California reserved for the new construction of the Career Technical Education Facility on the Fillmore High School campus

img.alt: Fillmore USD Vision, Mission, Core Values, and Strategic Goals Featured Photo

div.div: The Governing Board adopted adopted Board Policies 0000 and 0200 (Vision, Mission, Core Values, and Strategic Goals) at the December 18, 2018 board meeting. A digital version of the updated board policy accompanies this post.

div.p: Every day we develop high-performing students who become engaged and productive members of society.

Fillmore Unified School district prohibits discrimination, harassment, intimidation, and bullying based on actual or perceived ancestry, age, color, disability, gender, gender identity, gender expression, nationality, race or ethnicity, religion, sex, sexual orientation, or association with a person or a group with one or more of these actual or perceived characteristics.
Any issues or concerns must be filed in writing with the District’s Compliance Officer, Micheline Miglis, Assistant Superintendent, Educational Services, Fillmore Unified School District, 627 Sespe Ave., Fillmore, CA 93015, Telephone: 805-524-6036, Email: mmiglis@fillmoreusd.org
